Posted By: GrantAres (11/27/2009 5:41:27 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
My favorite card of the set, just for the black hate. Zendikar is wildly unbalanced, and I'm sick of losing to vampires.
  
   
With a bit of strategic bouncing from [Narrow Escape](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Narrow Escape) and her [Kor buddies](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=178145), she can lock down a mono-black opponent by herself. And she's the perfect answer to [Vampire Nighthawk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Nighthawk), who is the bane of my existence.
  
   
You go, girl! Burn those bloodsuckers DOWN!
posts.html:
My favorite card of the set, just for the black hate. Zendikar is wildly unbalanced, and I'm sick of losing to vampires.

With a bit of strategic bouncing from Narrow Escape and her Kor buddies, she can lock down a mono-black opponent by herself. And she's the perfect answer to Vampire Nighthawk, who is the bane of my existence.

You go, girl! Burn those bloodsuckers DOWN!

Posted By: SorianSadaskan (3/20/2010 9:07:32 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Streamhopper: Royal A-ssa-ssin (curse you yet again, profanity filter), unlike M.C Hammer, can't touch this. The black card targets, and protection means you can't target it. [Damnation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Damnation) would still kill it, since it doesn't use "target".
  
   
So, Zendicar had very little other colour hate- unlike, lets say, Shadowmoor. And when you see colour hate outside a core set, there's something that should be examined. Of course, we all know this is Vampires. I'm not sure why they were the only real tribal (allies don't count) in the set, but it's obvious this card was made for nerfin' (and that's just what it'll do). I mean, the Kor have a Lord present, but they don't seem to have quite the support that the bloodsuckers do. I'm glad they printed answers, but I think the best answer would be to tone them down in Worldwake in favour of some other strategies. Not to exclude them entirely, obviously, but still. Vampire Nighthawk.
posts.html:

So, Zendicar had very little other colour hate- unlike, lets say, Shadowmoor. And when you see colour hate outside a core set, there's something that should be examined. Of course, we all know this is Vampires. I'm not sure why they were the only real tribal (allies don't count) in the set, but it's obvious this card was made for nerfin' (and that's just what it'll do). I mean, the Kor have a Lord present, but they don't seem to have quite the support that the bloodsuckers do. I'm glad they printed answers, but I think the best answer would be to tone them down in Worldwake in favour of some other strategies. Not to exclude them entirely, obviously, but still. Vampire Nighthawk.
